text:
and wasn't set before. Otherwise, in the build.xml,

  <echo message="${env.ANT_HOME}" />

results in 
[echo] ${env.ANT_HOME}
creator: hauser@acm.org
hauser@acm.org
text: *** Bug 24552 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
use the ant.home property.

You can't rely on ANT_HOME being correct when Ant has been run from within an IDE
anyway, but the IDE is likely to at least set the ant.home property (since a few
other things like running external commands with vmlauncher="false" rely on it).
*** Bug 24694 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: bodewig@apache.org
labrown@efn.org
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> *** Bug 24694 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

24694 is _not_ a duplicate of this bug.  It deals with JAVA_HOME not ANT_HOME.
